definition: head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc

sentences.english: The bedrooms are rearranged on the first level to accommodate the living space and terrace.
sentences.chinese: 卧室被安置在首层，以适应起居空间和露台空间。

sentences.english: The daily work hanging basket should stop above the first safety net the position.
sentences.chinese: 每天作业完的吊篮应停在首层安全网以上位置。

sentences.english: G/ F. , No. 8, Lu Hua East Road, Shi Long Town, Dong Guan City, China.
sentences.chinese: 中国广东省东莞市石龙镇绿化东路8号首层。

sentences.english: At ground level, the Youth Zone new building appears as two sections.
sentences.chinese: 青年活动新大楼首层划分为两个区。

sentences.english: The apartment is located in the city centre of Valencia on the first floor of a five-storey building.
sentences.chinese: 这个公寓位于城市中心，是一个五层建筑的首层。

sentences.english: On this floor there is a utility room with all technical equipment, the main staircase and the spa zone (with sauna and bathroom).
sentences.chinese: 首层的杂物间容纳了所有设备，还有主楼梯和温泉室。

sentences.english: Several pancaked cars are visible under the collapsed ground floor.
sentences.chinese: 在垮塌的首层废墟之下能看到几辆被压成薄饼的汽车。

sentences.english: A large number of residential and commercial buildings were built with soft stories at the first-floor level.
sentences.chinese: 大量的住宅和商业建筑在首层都建成了软楼层。

sentences.english: Stone walls surround bedrooms on the ground floor, which nestle against the rock face.
sentences.chinese: 首层石墙紧贴着悬崖的石面，勾勒出卧室的外轮廓。

definition: house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
alcove/bay in a room/unit of length used for rooms, approx. 3.3 meters
top floor/attic/loft/garret/penthouse/(flat) rooftop (often used as an outdoor living area etc)
(used in the names of grand buildings such as 百老匯大廈|百老汇大厦 Broadway Mansions (in Shanghai) or 帝國大廈|帝国大厦 Empire State Building etc)
